intro: Polyspora grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora starflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Polyspora grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
